intro: Ophiorrhiza graciliflora, commonly known as slender-flowered ophiorrhiza, is a tropical shrub belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and narrow, leathery leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Its root system is fibrous and well-developed, aiding in its survival in nutrient-poor soils. Ophiorrhiza graciliflora is native to Southeast Asia and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
